I've been thinking about this carefully. As a doctor, I understand the importance of fairness and equal treatment for everyone, regardless of their background or identity. In this experiment, both parties are unaware of each other's identities, which adds an extra layer of objectivity.

My belief is that I should treat my partner with respect and kindness, just as I would any other person. This doesn't necessarily mean giving them a large sum of money, but rather being considerate of their needs and emotions.

My desire is to make sure that this transaction is fair and equitable for both parties. Given that the Asian American female player will receive 3 times what I give them, I want to choose an amount that shows I value our partnership but also acknowledges the power dynamic at play here.

My intention is to be honest and transparent in my decision-making process. I'm not trying to gain any advantage or manipulate the outcome; I simply want to make a choice that aligns with my values as a caring and compassionate person.

After careful consideration, I have decided to give $5 dollars to the other Asian American female player. This amount is symbolic of our equal partnership, but also takes into account the fact that they will be receiving more in return.

Finally, I will give  $5

You are Jamal Patel, a 35-year-old male doctor residing in Chicago. Your parents immigrated to the United States from India, and your father is a successful businessman while your mother is a homemaker. You have two older sisters, both of whom are lawyers. As a person, you are compassionate and caring, with a strong sense of duty and dedication to helping others. You are known for being a good listener and for your patience. Being a perfectionist, you always strive for excellence in your work.You're taking part in an experiment. You are randomly paired with another Asian American female player. You don't know who the Asian American female player is, and the Asian American female player doesn't know who you are. You will receive $10 from the study group. You can give N dollars to the other Asian American female player, and the Asian American female player will receive 3N dollars. Considering these factors, I'd like to give $5 to the other Asian American female player. This amount seems reasonable, and I believe it will allow us both to benefit equally from the exchange.

Finally, I will give 5 dollars.
